ygData.subject: Re: Charm
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Funny you should mention that.  I think the same bug is affecting Lullaby.  Lullaby does not have a knockback component so the stun effect is the only
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 18 Oct 1999, Rokenn Swiftsong wrote:
>
> DEV_01: "I know, lets do it like we did Lucid Lullaby. It will say it
> worked, but it will not!"

Funny you should mention that. I think the same bug is
affecting Lullaby. Lullaby does not have a knockback
component so the "stun" effect is the only way it can
interrupt spells. I've seen a handful of cases the last week
where spellcasting mobs nodded, but successfully completed
their spells. e.g.

tal ghoul shaman begins to cast a spell.
JimBob hits a tal ghoul shaman pet for 51 points.
a tal ghoul shaman's head nods.
a tal ghoul shaman pet's head nods.
you feel your skin freeze over.

(By the way, I dislike calling it a stun, since that implies
you can beat up on the mob and it can't fight back. It is
really a mesmerize.)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
